metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46671 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
options.c in atftp before 0.7.5 reads past the end of an array, andconsequently discloses server-side /etc/group data to a remote client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

atftp - 0.7.git20210915-4
atftpd - 0.7.git20210915-4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: atftp package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.git20210915-4').
